content:
This is a challenging day for our industry and we are sad to see Rex enter voluntary administration with the immediate suspension of its Boeing 737 operations.

We know this will be a difficult period for many Rex customers and employees and we stand ready to assist.

If Rex employees would like to discuss opportunities within Qantas or Jetstar, particularly in specialised fields which are unique to aviation, we’ve set up a dedicated link on our careers website.

Employees can express their interest by applying here and completing the questionnaire, in addition to attaching their current resume.

Rex customers impacted by cancelled flights due to the grounding of their domestic jet services can contact Qantas and Jetstar to be reaccommodated on the same route as their original booking at no charge, where we have seats available.

Customers with an impacted Rex booking can contact Jetstar on Live Chat or 13 15 38 and Qantas on 13 13 13 to make a booking. They have until 31 August 2024 to take up the offer.

The overlapping routes are:

Sydney-Adelaide

Sydney-Brisbane

Sydney Gold Coast

Sydney-Melbourne

 

 

Melbourne-Adelaide

Melbourne-Brisbane

Melbourne-Canberra

Melbourne-Hobart

Melbourne-Gold Coast

Melbourne-Perth

Adelaide-Brisbane

Adelaide-Perth

Brisbane – Cairns

 

 
  1. Customer must hold a current booking with Rex for a cancelled flight on an Eligible Route (“Rex Customer”).
  2. Rex Customer agrees to provide, as requested by Jetstar, Rex booking information including booking reference (PNR), travel dates, route, and passenger names.
  3. Subject to availability and verification of eligibility, Jetstar will offer a Rex Customer a Starter fare on a Jetstar operated flight on an Eligible Route that matches the customer’s passenger names, travel dates, baggage allowance and original departure and arrival port, as specified on the Rex itinerary (“Rex Customer Offer”). Customer is not able to book to a new origin or destination, and this is only available on direct flights on the Eligible Routes.  Only one Rex Customer Offer will be available per Rex booking across Qantas and Jetstar;
  4. Rex Customer Offer will be on a Jetstar operated flight with the lowest available fare on the same day and route as the original Rex booking, or the lowest available fare on the closest available date if the same day is not available; 
  5. To take up this offer, Rex Customers can request a new booking by Jetstar Live Chat  or 131 538. Requests must be made by 31 August 2024. Contact centre booking fee does not apply.  Bookings made through the Jetstar website or via a third party are not eligible.
  6. Jetstar will determine, in its sole discretion, whether a customer is a Rex Customer and whether space is available on a Jetstar operated flight.  Jetstar reserves the right to cancel any Rex Customer Offer booking in the event Jetstar determines, in its reasonable discretion, that a customer has not complied with these terms and conditions including applying for duplicate bookings across Qantas and/or Jetstar or has not complied with Jetstar’s Fare Rules or Conditions of Carriage.
  7. Jetstar Starter Fare Rules apply. Tickets are not transferrable or redeemable for cash.
  8. All travel is subject to Jetstar’s Conditions of Carriage and other relevant policies, which are available on Jetstar’s website at jetstar.com

UPDATE: 5pm Sunday 21 July 2024.

Our IT systems are back up and running and our operations are running as scheduled.

We ask passengers to please proceed to the Airport as usual. You can check the status of your flight here.

For customers impacted by flight cancellations between Friday 19 July and up to 2am AEST Saturday 20 July, we sincerely apologise and appreciate this would have been a frustrating experience. 

If you have been impacted and need assistance, please contact us via Live Chat to discuss your options. We are offering additional flexibility (including free moves +14 days or voucher refund).

The global software issue impacted multiple Jetstar systems, including the system we use to communicate to customers. With our IT systems now back up and running we have contacted everyone whose flight was cancelled with new flight options.

We’re working hard to help customers as quickly as possible and appreciate everyone's understanding and patience.

Customers should be wary of scammers, and we advise not to share financial details with anyone claiming to represent Jetstar. If you need assistance with your booking, please reach out on Live Chat.

The Brisbane domestic terminal is moving to online check-in to help customers skip the queue and save time. 

Please check in online via the Jetstar app or our website, and download your boarding pass before arriving at the airport. Online check-in opens 48 hrs before your flight and closes 40 min before departure. 

We’ve also introduced new airport kiosks that allow you to quickly print off your bag tags. To use these, you just need to scan your boarding pass, print off the tag and attach it to your checked baggage. 

If you can’t check in online, our staff at Brisbane Airport will be available to help check you in on the day. 

For more information, see Brisbane Airport upgrades.

All travellers entering Singapore, including Singapore citizens, are required to complete the online Singapore Arrival Card (SGAC).

This must be completed before checking in and boarding your flight. 

If you are only transiting through Singapore, you do not need to submit a SGAC - this is only required if you are clearing immigration at Changi Airport. 

The form can be submitted up to three days before you are expected to arrive in Singapore.

alert: Jetstar (JQ) domestic flights will operate from Terminal 2 at Perth Airport
content:
From 2 September 2024, all Jetstar (JQ) domestic flights will depart and arrive from Terminal 2 at Perth Airport. Currently our domestic flights operate from Terminal 3.  

The move will significantly reduce customers’ journey time between domestic and international services. 

Jetstar’s international flights will continue to operate from Terminal 1 which is adjacent to Terminal 2 in the Airport Central precinct.  

Qantas flights operate from Terminals 3 and 4, and passengers connecting between Qantas and Jetstar flights from 2 September 2024, are advised to allow additional transit time. 

For more information about how to travel between terminals precincts and maps, please visit the Perth Airport website.
link: /au/en/travel-alerts#Jetstar (JQ) domestic flights will operate from Terminal 2 at Perth Airport

content:
Complete your travel declaration online up to 24 hours before you start your trip to New Zealand. This online form is free and replaces the paper arrival card. To learn more or to start your NZTD, visit the official website. 

Important: We’ve become aware of unofficial websites charging a fee for a NZTD. Please always use the official website link above as there’s no fee and it ensures that we receive your declaration.
